tip.text: Try the veal!
Headed home
Take the stairs; its good for you, and usually faster, depending on your athleticism.
Use the 7th and 31st entrance, not as many people use it. It's great!
No toilet paper in the public restrooms.
There is another set of ticket machines behind track 3! There r never any lines there
Rose's pizza has the best beer
Acela to Boston: wait downstairs and watch the arrival board for the arriving DC train w/ same number. Walk down and grab open seats before the crowds arrive.
Looks like a lennys deli just opened up on 34th and seventh. Get your eats there if need a sandwich for the ride.
Running across Penn at rush hour is a bit like football practice
Just keep in mind that this (commuting thing) sucks equally for everyone. Try to ignore the drunk sport-tards, guidos, and treat the homeless people and faux armed guards with courtesy.
Wear earplugs Friday and Saturday after 6pm.. The alcohos don't shaddddup
Make sure to grab and ice coffee for the ride & sit near a car with a bathroom. :)
Not as bad as people make it out to be! Not nearly as nice as Grand Central or what Penn Station was before they tore it down, but Amtrak runs out of this station and is my gateway to the city.
don't sit on the floor in the acela waiting area or you will be forcibly removed by the boys in blue...the nypd, not the acela employees
If you are taking the Acela you don't have to wait upstairs. Go down and look at the monitors on the lower level.
The bathrooms are exquisite. Don't forget to tip the towel guy!
Zaro's has the best black and white cookies.
This place sucks
Megabus is right on the corner. Don't forget to buy water an food for the ride.
Be sure to curse Robert Moses for having this place built!
Welcome to Penn Station! Don't forget to check in to Foursquare from the train as well. Trains, buses, planes, & boats are all valid Foursquare venues that you can become the mayor of!
Since you're here, don't bother checking in or your coworkers will cry foul that you're whooping their butts at Foursquare! Also? Make up places like moving destinations and train routes! :P
Heading back to Boston!!!
Fuck this place.
This place sucks. Too many bad memories
If you haven't tried a smoothie from Smoothie King, it'll totally take your mind off of things, especially after a long day at work.
If taking NJ transit or LIRR, try to use the 8th avenue side by Amtrak. The lines to get on the train are shorter and there is more room to breathe. You might even get a better seat on the train.
For newark airport go to NJ transit ticket machines. If EWR is not an option on the initial screen, select Other Destinations > N > newark airport
Go out to 'wichcraft express at 32nd and Broadway for a great fast meal; I can reco the pressed gruyere with caramelized onions on rye.
Amtrak to Albany or other upstate destinations? Get in line at track 5. You'll be right & might get to board before it's posted. Sit on left side (facing front) for Hudson River views on your trip.
Go read the Grand Central Terminal tips to feel even more depressed about your Penn commute.
Always check the arrivals monitors inside the SW entrance to get a jump on Acela boarding
I like to scream Go Tigers! when on a train full of Yankee fans.
If you have to talk on your cell when on the train, make sure to do it on speakerphone - it will make everyone very happy.
Go home.
Go home.
Go home
Get on ur train and go home
Just breeze past the gate keepers if you want to sit in the waiting area. Long as you don't smell/look drunk no one will stop you.
Try the meat ball sub
Bathrooms are gross
If you change your mind about the diet and want an Auntie Anne's pretzel, don't turn around- there's another one coming up less than 100 feet away. And yes, you will smell like it on the train.
Always an adventure here!
New Yorkers used to enter like royalty. Now we enter like rats. Enter only if you really, really need to take the train somewhere.
All train operators are non-minorities, anomalous for blue collar jobs.

Nowhere else in the world (except maybe Popcorn Land?) can you find so many different popcorn vendors to choose from. The best ones are lower level, the long, white bags (not Zarro's and not the movie
Finding a seat to sit down is like searching for a unicorn, they're hard to find and almost don't exist. Guess it's to deter homeless.
The smoothies at planet smoothies are intolerable. Real fruit doesn't taste this sweet, they must add a ton of sugar. Not even drinkable 3 sips in.
Do NOT use the bathroom by Amtrack. All crackheads. Go by the LIRR or New Jersey transit.
Don pepes has a good italian sub!
Stay to the right while standing on escalators to let people pass on the left
Moe's Southwest Grill is a good place to eat while waiting for your train. Same with Charlie's subs. Just watch for the shady people in the back seating area at Charlie's
If u have pull along luggage I hate u and will try my best to kick it down the stairs as I race to my train
Amtrak offers free wifi in the concourse
Try to get to your train early. There's hardly any good seats if you don't. And to those douchebags who put bags on seats: kindly use the storage rack above you. Thanks. :-)
One of the only express trains to huntington. Make sure you get to Penn by 6:20 to get a seat. It gets crowded!
The lower level south corridor is hardly crowded as compared north corridor where all the shops are
The 4:51 Ronkonkoma train is 99% of the time always on track 13. Take a seat early if you can!
Free WiFi at the McDonald's at the end of the LIRR concourse. Look for "attwifi."
During the rush hours, it should be an easy spot to unlock the swarm badge.
Pretty sure I stepped over a dead guy at the top of the escalator. Going to cry now.
I hate this place.
Tracks Bar & Grille is pretty good
If you're riding Amtrak, wait downstairs underneath the big departure board. There are departure monitors there, and you can walk directly on to the track and be the first one on the train.
When getting to JFK Airport by the A-Eighth Avenue Express is too slow to Sutphin Boulevard–Archer Avenue–JFK station, get a $3.50 one-way CityTicket and get to Jamaica (JFK AirTrain) in less time!
When getting to Flushing-Main Street gets tough because the 7 is under construction... or when the N is too slow to Queensboro Plaza, get a $3.50 one-way CityTicket and get to Flushing in 2 stations!
Avoid the coffee at Zaro's. Bagels are great but coffee is so so.
Do not walk 1mph and take up the whole stairs walking up/down them.
Don't wait in the 7th ave taxi line. Go to the SE corner of 33rd, grab an incoming cab and avoid the wait.
Is smoothie king still there. Went too smoothie world. Way too sweet.
best place to find homeless people in nyc!
Ahh, the smell of piss in the morning!
They have free wifi now
Do not use the starbucks next to the fridays in the LIRR section there the slowest starbucks ever!
Wait for your train at local and grab a bear
To avoid the fecal frappé of the public men rooms use your acela lounge commodes
I'm still waiting for my west side yard track but it never gets a track number.
Flight Cancelled? Morgans Hotel Group in NY is offering up to 25% off this week thru 2/28 for those stranded by the snow! Book: http://twurl.nl/3hi1sx
All u iPhone users.... are whiny babies. Android FTW
99 cent breakfast 2 eggs on a roll. Can't be beat! Lower concourse
Tim hortons is awesome and you can
depending on where you are in Penn / there are two Starbucks, one nearer the ACE (close to Rosa's Pizza) the other down towards the 123 (past K-Mart) - both on the LIRR level
I prefer its other name: The 10th Level of Hell.
Stuck in NY? Morgans, Royalton and Hudson are offering up to 25% off this week thru 2/14 for those stranded because of the snow. Book: http://twurl.nl/3hi1sx
Avoid the crowd - use the stairway near the 31st and 8th exit to quickly board an NJ Transit train.
There's a nice Amtrack passanger seating area in the middle which is better then sitting out with the crowds.
Smoothie king on east side is 50 cents cheaper
Go to the no name tossed salad store and order a breakfast with beef sausage. Beef sausage runs out early, though
More delays than your avg. airport on a good day.

most nyc cab drivers wouldn't be caught dead picking up a passenger straying from the penn station taxi stand lines, so don't waste time trying to find a cab, go straight to one of the two taxi stands
Acela quiet car
If trying to save money don't go into TGI Fridays it's $25 just for an entree alone!
Gelato Gelato Gelato: Right in front of Rosa's Pizza. Served 24/7. Perfect when you're stuck there late at night.
Grab a cheap beer while you wait. Cheap and somehow so relaxing!
Surprisingly good pizza, dunno the name but it's close to the Amtrak information desk
Grab a bottle of vino from Penn Wine
They have trains that go almost anywhere on long island! Good price and great service. I would use again.
Get there an hour before if you have to buy your ticket at the counter - 30 mins before if you have it or can use the quicktrak.
Use the Acela Lounge if you have a first class ticket or Select Plus status. Much more civilized place to wait, especially if your train is delayed.
Dont clog the main area while watching what track your train is on
buy a beer after getting off the train
Go to Rosa's Pizzeria... 3 Dollar 30 Oz beers. Pregame before a Rangers game, or whatever.
Make your 12:34 am train at all costs, or expect your trip home to be that much more time consuming and expensive.
trains to secaucus are delayed
buy your ticket last minute while standing in line, but use your iPhone to do it. sometimes they have empty seats on booked buses and you can skip the line.
rooftop cafe at Local (33rd and 8th) an excellent place to wait for your train
Enter the greatest city ib the world feeling like a rat exiting the sewar. Friggin' kill yourself.
sit at rear of inbound lirr trains to b closer to 34th st exits
hold your breath.
buy a ticket from NY to Montreal on tomorrow's 8:30a train
If you plan on buying a drink from one of the magazine vendors dont. Go to the Kmart and buy your beverage there and save a $1
the seating area says "accela express ticket holders only" but that's just for mornings. don't be deceived by dumb signage. put up your feet.
to avoid the line and get a seat on the regional express, watch for the Amtrak employee to reverse the escalator--that is your stairway
Dont forget to get a Planet Smoothie. Good stuff and shakes.
get an excellent salad next door to Rosa's pizza- which incidentally has awesome pizza. closer to 8th ave side.
Move to NYC with a large backpack and a floor to crash on.
makes fun of the loser rangers fans.
it is a really long walk from penn station to the far end of 6th ave. 2-3 miles sounds like nothing to run. feels really far when walking w dress shoes and a rolley suitcase.
Go inside your own soul and find true horror. Reward yourself with a can of Sprite.
Try the veal!
Headed home

Use the 7th and 31st entrance, not as many people use it. It's great!

Use the Acela Lounge if you have a first class ticket or Select Plus status. Much more civilized place to wait, especially if your train is delayed.
Dont clog the main area while watching what track your train is on
buy a beer after getting off the train
Go to Rosa's Pizzeria... 3 Dollar 30 Oz beers. Pregame before a Rangers game, or whatever.
Make your 12:34 am train at all costs, or expect your trip home to be that much more time consuming and expensive.
trains to secaucus are delayed
buy your ticket last minute while standing in line, but use your iPhone to do it. sometimes they have empty seats on booked buses and you can skip the line.
rooftop cafe at Local (33rd and 8th) an excellent place to wait for your train
Enter the greatest city ib the world feeling like a rat exiting the sewar. Friggin' kill yourself.
sit at rear of inbound lirr trains to b closer to 34th st exits
hold your breath.
buy a ticket from NY to Montreal on tomorrow's 8:30a train
If you plan on buying a drink from one of the magazine vendors dont. Go to the Kmart and buy your beverage there and save a $1
the seating area says "accela express ticket holders only" but that's just for mornings. don't be deceived by dumb signage. put up your feet.
to avoid the line and get a seat on the regional express, watch for the Amtrak employee to reverse the escalator--that is your stairway
Dont forget to get a Planet Smoothie. Good stuff and shakes.
get an excellent salad next door to Rosa's pizza- which incidentally has awesome pizza. closer to 8th ave side.
Move to NYC with a large backpack and a floor to crash on.
makes fun of the loser rangers fans.
it is a really long walk from penn station to the far end of 6th ave. 2-3 miles sounds like nothing to run. feels really far when walking w dress shoes and a rolley suitcase.
Go inside your own soul and find true horror. Reward yourself with a can of Sprite.
